body.description: Tá an focal "$1" san fhoclóir, ach tá brí eile leis sa chomhthéacs seo.
The word "$1" is in the dictionary, but it has a different meaning in this context.
Má thagann an t-alt agus ainmfhocal ("$2") i lorg ainmfhocail eile ("$1"), ní mór don dara hainmfhocal a bheith sa ghinideach.
If the article and noun ("$2") follow another noun ("$1"), the second noun must be in the genitive case.

examples.ex: Áras an Uachtaráin. Oifig an Phoist. Éadaí na mná. Lár na páirce.

body.description: Never change the case of proper nouns
Ná hathraigh cás ainmfhocail chinnte

examples.ex: An tUachtarán. Cumann na mBan.

body.description: When "tá" has a first person pronoun to the right, use "is" and not "tá".
Nuair a bhíonn "tá" le forainm den chéad phearsa ar dheis, bain úsáid as "is" agus ní "tá".
Milk and sugar ar put on the coffee, not into coffee
Cuirtear bainne agus siúcra ar an gcaife, ní chuirtear isteach sa chaife iad.

examples.ex: An gcuireann tú siúcra ar do chaife? Tá bainne ar an gcaife.

body.description: Milk and sugar ar put on the tea, not into tea
Cuirtear bainne agus siúcra ar an tae, ní chuirtear isteach sa tae iad.

examples.ex: An gcuireann sé bainne ar an tae? Tá siúcra ar an tae.

body.description: "De" should be used instead of "do" after "beag is fiú"
Ba cheart "de" a úsáid in ionad "do" i ndiaidh "beag is fiú"

examples.ex: Beag is fiú a dhéanamh de dhuine. Ná déan beag is fiú díom.

body.description: Add description
Cuir cur síos leis

header.title: Fada buí and ó go together
Bíonn fada buí agus ó le chéile

body.description: When using the phrase "fada buí", the preposition "ó" must be used.
Nuair atáthar ag tagairt do "fada buí", ní mór an réamhfhocal "ó" a bheith leis.

examples.ex: Is fada buí uaim é a chreidiúint.

body.description: Add description
Cuir cur síos leis
Add description
Cuir cur síos leis
Add description
Cuir cur síos leis
Add description
Cuir cur síos leis

examples.ex: Chuaigh an long go tóin poill.

body.description: Add description
Cuir cur síos leis
Add description
Cuir cur síos leis
The particle "a" is required before verbs.
Is gá an mhír "a" a chur roimh bhriathair.

examples.ex: An méid a dhéanann an tÚdarás.

header.title: Alt cinnte an ainmfhocail
The definite article of the noun

body.description: Má thagann an t-alt "$2" roimh an ainmfhocail, "$1" sa chás seo, ba cheart go mbeadh sé cinnte.
If the article "$2" precedes the noun, "$1" in this case, it should be in the definite form.

examples.ex: An t-uachtarán.

body.description: Is ceart an réamhfhocal AR a úsáid nuair atáthar ag caint faoin am ar an gclog.
The preposition AR should be used when talking about the time on the clock.

examples.ex: Ithfear an dinnéar ar a seacht a chlog.

body.description: Bítear ar an aonach, ní ag an aonach.
One is on the fair, not at the fair.

examples.ex: Bhí slua mór ar an aonach inniu.

header.title: Ba cheart go n-aontódh an aidiacht le hinscne an ainmfhocail.
The adjective should agree with the gender of the noun.

body.description: Ní mór don aidiacht,"$1" sa chás seo, teacht le hinscne an ainmfhocail, "$2" sa chás seo.
The adjective, "$1" in this case, must agree with the gender of the noun, "$2" in this case.

examples.ex: Beidh slua mór ar an bhfaiche mhór an Aoine bheag seo.

header.title: Consan séimhithe i lorg an réamhfhocail bhaininscnigh
Lenited consonant following the feminine preposition

body.description: Tá séimhiú in easnamh.
The lenition is missing.

examples.ex: Níor oscail mé an fhuinneog mhór.

body.description: Is é an réamhfhocal ó a thagann i lorg an bhriathair teastaigh.
The preposition ó follows the verb teastaigh.

examples.ex: Teastaíonn post nua uaim.

body.description: "Do" not "de" is the correct preposition to use with the verb "inis".
Is é "do" seachas "de" an réamhfhocal ceart a théann leis an mbriathar "inis".

examples.ex: Inis don phríomhoide céard a tharla.

header.title: Bíonn uimhir uatha ann i lorg an fhocail cúpla
The singular form follows the word cúpla

body.description: Bíonn uimhir uatha ann i lorg an fhocail cúpla.
The singular form follows the word cúpla.

examples.ex: Cúpla lá, cúpla focal, cúpla bliain.

header.title: Anginideach i lorg ainmfhocail ama.
The genitive follows a noun of time.

body.description: Nuair a thagann dhá ainmfhocal le chéile, bíonn an dara hainmfhocal sa ghinideach.
When two nouns come together, the second noun is in the genitive.

examples.ex: I rith na bliana, i rith na seachtaine, le linn an tsamhraidh, ar feadh an lae.

body.description: Nuair a bhíonn réamhfhocal "$2" agus an t-alt "an" le chéile, ní mór urú a bheith ar an bhfocal ina lorg, "$1" sa chás seo.
When the preposition "$2" and the article "an" are together, eclipsis must be applied to the following word, "$1" in this case.

examples.ex: Ar an mbord, ag an bhfuinneog, chuig an gcomhairle.

header.title: An ginideach i lorg na haidiachta sealbhaí
The genitive follows the possessive adjective

body.description: Nuair a thagann dhá ainmfhocal le chéile, bíonn an dara focal sa ghinideach. Ní chuireann an aidiacht shealbhach an ginideach ar ceal.
When two nouns come together, the second noun is in the genitive. The possessive adjective does not cancel the genitive.

examples.ex: Cúl a chinn, dath a capaill, doras mo thí, teach m'athar.

body.description: Séimhiú i ndiaidh aidiachta sealbhaí.
Lenition follows a possessive adjective.

examples.ex: Cúl a chinn, dath a capaill, doras mo thí, teach m'athar.

body.description: You have used three periods, "$1". Here an ellipsis would have been a better choice.
Tá tú tar éis trí phonc a úsáid, "$1". B'fhearr comhartha focalbhá a úsáid anseo.
Use double-angle quotation marks
Úsáid comharthaí athfhriotail uillinne dúbailte
This word is not in the dictionary
Níl an focal sin san fhoclóir
